1PUL;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dvV03UxqIOk;"1PUL (1st Place You Look
column2: pronounced ""one pull"") is a Flutter web app (prototype) that inventories items moved by people
column3: and has an interface to search the inventory. In an environment with many items and lots of storage options (like a busy household or an office)
column4: it can be challenging to 1) track down the last place an item was seen
column5: and 2) have all the items in mind when trying to solve a problem or fulfill a list. 1PUL can also be used to actively inventory a collection of items.

column1: When the Flutter code detects movement from the camera by comparing frames
column2: it hits the Gemini API with a camera frame and a prompt like
column3: ""if there's a person holding an object
column4: and the object is clearly visible
column5: describe the object"". Gemini's object description
column6: plus the still image url
column8: and (optionally) transcribed audible comments from the person
column9: are written to a Google Sheet. The still image is uploaded to a GCS bucket. The capturing device running 1PUL will also briefly show that an item is being inventoried.

column1: Inventory Search is a feature that sends a user query (ex: ""what camping gear do I have""
column2: ""where's my socket wrench"") to the Gemini API
column3: along with the full inventory descriptions (thanks for the giant context window!)
column4: with a prompt like
column5: ""match this user query to the most relevant item descriptions"". There's some prompting to get structured output
column6: which the dart code maps back to inventory items to present to the user.";Flutter

column1: AfiHunt AI;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jBD6AZ4YGwk;"AfiHunt AI is a cutting-edge browser extension designed specifically for affiliate marketers

column1: It works by first obtaining an API key from the AfiHunt AI dashboard
column2: simply input it into the API Key field on the extension's options page to activate it. From there
column3: the magic begins. As you browse websites
column4: AfiHunt AI scans each browsed page in real-time and obtains the texts and links
column5: these texts and links are then sent to the backend hosted on firebase cloud functions for processing. Here
column6: the texts and links are sent to the tuned model through the Vertex AI Gemini API for analysis
column7: to determine if an affiliate program is present. If a program is detected
column8: response is sent back to the function and then to the extension which alerts the user with a notification

column1: AI Shift;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kPdlY0l1XNg;"AI Shift is a web app that automates and optimizes shift scheduling. Simply input your complex workplace rules
column2: and it will generate shifts that meet both employee preferences and operational needs
column3: considering factors like interpersonal relationships and individual circumstances that traditional methods often struggle to handle.

column1: Shift creation has long been a complex challenge in workforce management. Traditional mathematical optimization methods simply allocate staff numbers to meet basic requirements. However
column2: they cannot handle complex workplace constraints like interpersonal factors
column3: individual preferences
column4: or nuanced company policies.

column1: Moreover
column2: relying solely on generative AI for shift creation also presents challenges. While AI excels at understanding shift rules
column3: it struggles with aggregating data and performing the type of mathematical optimizations that traditional methods handle well.

column1: To address these limitations
column2: we've implemented a hybrid Chain-of-Thought method
column3: where non-AI code performs the statistical analysis that AI typically struggles with
column4: and feeds this aggregated data back to the AI. AI Shift overcomes these limitations through this hybrid approach that combines the power of large language models (LLMs) with specialized non-AI algorithms.

column1: AI Shift uses Gemini in 3 steps:
1. Generate initial shifts from user input.
2. Refine shifts by adding statistical analysis data by non-AI algorithm.
3. Validate shifts against workplace rules.";Web/Chrome
column2: Firebase;ams.jp;Japan;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/ai-shift

column1: AI-Team is a TDPnet system comprising the following Service Providers (SPs):

Player: Implements the logic of a player

column1: Kronia: Synchronizes processes across the system to ensure consistent performance.
Hub: Acts as a central node where desks
column2: players
column3: and Kronia connect to notify actions and events. It also maintains the game's parameters and updated state.

column1: AskGemini;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XnjJA2Jmsog;"Integration with Gemini API
The Gemini API provides robust image recognition capabilities
column2: which you can harness to identify food items within uploaded images. Hereƒ??s how you can integrate it:

column1: 1. API Authentication:
-> Obtain API keys and authenticate requests to access Gemini's image recognition services.
2. Image Upload and Processing:
-> Users upload images via your application's frontend.
-> The backend sends these images to Gemini API endpoints for analysis.
3. Image Analysis:
-> Gemini API processes the images and returns descriptive information about the contents
column2: identifying food items present.

column1: -> This information includes textual descriptions and possibly metadata about recognized objects.
4. Response Handling:
-> Backend receives the response from Gemini API.
-> Parse and extract relevant food item descriptions and metadata to proceed with recipe retrieval.
User Interaction and Experience
Creating a seamless user experience is crucial for the success of your application:
1. Upload and Analysis Flow:
-> Guide users through the process of uploading images and waiting for analysis results from Gemini API.
2. Recipe Presentation:
-> Once analysis is complete
column2: present the identified food items and corresponding recipes in an organized manner.

column1: 3. Error Handling and Feedback:
-> Implement error handling for cases where the Gemini API fails to recognize items or returns inaccurate results.";Web/Chrome;;India;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/askgemini

column1: Atmosphere;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EMdi0880IrE;"Atmosphere interacts with the Google Gemini Flash API in 2 independent steps to generate immersive and cohesive audio recordings.
Step 1: Timestamps
Initially
column2: Atmosphere is provided with the audio recording in its entirety
column3: and is tasked with locating timestamps within the audio book that correspond to scenes that would be enhanced by ambient audio. In addition to providing the timestamp of these scenes
column4: Gemini also produces a concise description of the context of the scene
column5: and salient keywords from the scene that construct the overall tone of the segment.

column1: Step 2: Mappings
Using the keywords gathered for each scene identified by Gemini
column2: Atmosphere sifts through the 33
column3: 000+ sound effects and their associated keywords in the BBC sound effects library
column4: and acquires all sounds with at least one keyword matching that of the scene. With all sound effects a minimum of one matching keyword compiled into a list
column5: Gemini is prompted to pick the sound from the list that best matches the scene description created by Gemini in step 1.

column1: Step 3: Overlay
Once all sounds have been selected for each scene
column2: Atmosphere normalizes
column3: fades
column4: trims then overlays the selected sound effects onto the corresponding audio book segments.";Web/Chrome;Paul Bokelman
column5: Sawyer Rice
column6: Rohan Koshy

column1: Audio Description Generator;Create descriptive audio tracks for YouTube videos within minutes.;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZiYewspy8hw;"The Audio Description Generator app is a tool for creating descriptive audio tracks for short YouTube videos within minutes. Once given a YouTube link
column2: the app fetches the video
column3: title
column4: and description. It then begins by splitting the video into smaller chunks. These chunks
column5: alongside the YouTube data
column6: are first used to create a ""context file"" using Gemini
column7: this acts as a first pass to detect general details and identify any characters. Then each chunk is used to make a ""loudness file"" which measures the volume at every interval and a ""transcript"" (using Gemini) which lists the dialogue from the video with timestamps. All this information is then fed to Gemini once again to create a ""script"" of observations with timestamps. These scripts are then put through Google Cloud's Text-to-Speech
column8: the resulting audio is stitched back together
column9: and the final result is presented to the user.";Web/Chrome

column1: Automated Image-Based Measurement Tool;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OyhzJzUJOvQ;"Transistors are essential components in integrated circuits

column1: Bot Or Not 1;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u92l9tD1Mjo;"Bot Or Not presents players with a series of images with a description from recent news articles to leave short comments on. Players can then look at comments made by either other players

column1: Bot or Not 2;A reverse-Turing-test / odd man out based game;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bx8NIXUkEHM;"Imagine a world where the line between human and artificial intelligence blurs
column2: making perception the ultimate challenge. Welcome to Bot or Not
column3: a revolutionary game inspired by the Turing test. Unlike traditional tests aimed at identifying robots among humans
column4: Bot or Not challenges players to blend in as a human imposter among AI-controlled robots.

column1: In Bot or Not
column2: players navigate a series of tense rounds populated by ""robots."" However
column3: one of these robots is actually a human imposter. The objective is clear: blend in seamlessly or risk exposure and elimination.

column1: Each round unfolds in stages of gripping interaction. Participants engage in a conversation stage where moral questions probe ethics and reasoning
column2: setting the stage for subtle deception and strategy.

column1: As tension mounts
column2: the voting phase begins. Every ""robot"" casts a ballot
column3: aiming to identify the human imposter. With each elimination
column4: the stakes rise
column5: hinging on the playerƒ??s ability to evade detection and outwit the AI.

column1: Victory in Bot or Not is a testament to adaptability. The player triumphs by standing among the last two robots. Defeat is humbling for those who fail to convincingly integrate into the robotic facade and fall victim to collective scrutiny.
Bot or Not offers a compelling mix of psychological challenge and strategic gameplay. Are you ready to face the mind games? Step into a world
column2: where every word and action could mean the difference between elimination or survival.";;Bot or Not;United States;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/bot-or-not-2

column1: Camge.org;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a9pF0ZpSaFk;"The app is based on the theory of personality from Florence Littauer's book

column1: CelebriTwin;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UJs7KJv_0Rw;"This web application leverages the power of AI to find celebrity lookalikes based on user-uploaded images. Using Google's Gemini API for advanced image analysis and The Movie Database (TMDB) API for celebrity information
column2: our app offers a fun and engaging way to discover which famous personalities you resemble.

column1: Here's how it works:
Users upload their photo through an intuitive interface.
The Gemini API analyzes the image
column2: focusing on facial features such as face shape
column3: hairstyle
column4: eyes
column5: nose
column6: mouth

column1: Based on this analysis
column2: the API identifies a celebrity who closely resembles the user.

column1: The app then fetches the celebrity's image and information using the TMDB API.
Results are displayed side-by-side
column2: showing the user's photo and their celebrity match.

column1: Key features:
Simple and user-friendly interface
Real-time image processing and analysis
Integration with a vast database of celebrities
Instant results with visual comparison

column1: Cloudiff AI;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ohjbTeS-0KY;"Cloudiff AI is the first step in Zero Touch Governance
column2: Audit
column3: Security
column4: Financial Control and Complete Management of Hybrid Cloud Platform. We are a collection of Platform Engineers with 20 years experience and managing hybrid cloud platforms is a problem we want to solve now.

column1: Getting the right information about your platform at your fingertips through a human interface without IT support enables the business to make fast informed decisions and run realtime audits. We believe this will be used from C-Suite making critical decisions down to engineers onboarding to a new platform and learning the environment they work in.

Gemini has allowed us to use a graph of real world problems and give it a brain that understands all the complex information and their relationship. Abstracting complex data models and decoupling insightful information from manual effort. Our RAG based LLM solves a real world problem using Gemini. Throughout the six week build and test there are things to fix. We are currently bootstrapped so our app is running in Cloud Run that scales to 0 so sometimes the first ping hangs. column1: Cognitive Strike;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jO_yr83tQcQ;"The app aims to revolutionize preparation for various scenarios by using Gemini. column1: Crypto Dashboard;Retrieve real-time data crypto price to make a dashboard;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mzVfk6NgNHg;"Our application serves as a comprehensive cryptocurrency dashboard
column2: designed to provide users with real-time insights into cryptocurrency prices fetched from the Gemini API. This dashboard is split into a backend powered by Node.js and Express and a frontend developed using React.

column1: The backend operates on port 5000 and acts as a mediator between the frontend and the Gemini API. Key components of the backend include:
- Utilizes `express.json()` and `express.urlencoded()` to parse incoming request bodies. These are configured with a limit of 10MB
column2: ensuring compatibility with potentially larger payloads.

column1: - Implements CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) using the `cors` middleware to facilitate secure cross-origin requests from the frontend.
- Defines a GET endpoint (`/api/crypto`) responsible for fetching cryptocurrency price data from the Gemini API (`https://api.gemini.com/v1/pricefeed`).
- Utilizes Axios for making asynchronous HTTP requests to the Gemini API. These requests include a required API key (`X-GEMINI-APIKEY`)
column2: securely stored as an environment variable (`process.env.GEMINI_API_KEY`).";Web/Chrome;Nathan;New Zealand;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/crypto-dashboard

column1: DATAKI;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iT9YXwwOTUs;"DATAKI allows you to generate charts
column2: tables
column3: and full dashboards based on your data like never before. Currently
column4: it is compatible with BigQuery
column5: but support for other databases is coming soon. Simply ask for what you need through a chat interface and watch the charts and tables come to life.

column1: # Why Create DATAKI?
In the past couple of years
column2: we got used to interacting with computers in a conversational way. To the point where we expect it
column3: especially in advanced tools. It feels frustrating going into Google Analytics or Looker Studio and not being able to do the same thing. So
column4: we decided to try and implement it ourselves. We use BigQuery a lot
column5: and it felt like a natural starting point.

column1: # What Can You Do with It?
Imagine having a top-notch data scientist who can give you results in a beautiful way
column2: instantly.

column1: - DATAKI can answer questions in natural language. It can use a function to access the BigQuery data directly. Every SQL request that DATAKI makes is displayed to the user.
- CHARTS: Generate complex charts based on Charts.js. Each one includes a SQL statement and a JSON config in our own format for the visualization.
- TABLES: Automatically paginated and virtualized. Filters and sorting are coming soon.
You can also modify existing charts and tables with Gemini
column2: even after they have been added to a dashboard. Additionally
column3: apply date filters
column4: copy and paste
column5: move and resize widgets in dashboards...

column1: # Tech
DATAKI is based on our own FireCMS and Firebase";Web/Chrome

column1: DDMD;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BxzJcNyZNEw;"The DDMD project aims to provide an AI-powered solution for detecting digital drug music. The process begins with the collection of 3
column2: 176 non-copyrighted MP3 files
column3: of which 1
column4: 676 are classified as digital drug music and 1
column5: 500 as not digital drug music.

column1: These files are used to develop a Random Forest-based model that can classify audio files as either digital drug music or not. The model utilizes 34 features extracted from these audio files
column2: covering both frequency and time-domain characteristics
column3: and has achieved very encouraging results.

column1: To make the results accessible and user-friendly
column2: we developed a web application. This application leverages the trained Random Forest model to classify audio files through a simple and intuitive interface. The DDMD web application is built using Flask for the backend and HTML/CSS for the frontend. It utilizes the pre-trained Random Forest model to make predictions
column3: accepting various audio file formats
column4: converting non-MP3 files to MP3
column5: and allowing input via a YouTube URL.

column1: Additionally
column2: to enhance classification accuracy
column3: we are exploring ways to improve the DDMD application by fine-tuning the Gemini-1.5-flash model. We have proposed two approaches: first
column4: we prepared a JSON dataset based on the Random Forest classifier results to fine-tune the Gemini-1.5-flash model. In the second approach
column5: we are using the Gemini API and experimenting with different input formats
column6: including CSV and JSON

column1: EverythingAI API;AI tasks trained without the need for dedicated large datasets.;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jMg3ZC-AvIM;"This API can detect deepfakes
column2: convert speech to text
column3: analysis of ASL sign language
column4: etc. without needing to be trained on any dataset. This is possible thanks to Gemini Flash 1.5 and their ""Imposition-Context"" technique.

column1: This API currently includes AI tasks such as: deepfake detection
column2: multilingual speech-to-text conversion with results exceeding whisper-large-v3 on multilingual audio
column3: detailed and accurate analysis and interpretation of sign language in videos
column4: classification of up to 80 emotional states of text in just 2 seconds
column5: and OCR with character detection and accuracy comparable to existing large OCR systems. And I am still working on integrating more AI tasks.

column1: If we simply feed the video to Gemini Flash 1.5 on its own
column2: it won't be able to detect the deepfake. You can see here
column3: Gemini Flash 1.5 is struggling to identify the deepfake. This is why I developed the ""Imposing-context"" prompting technique.

column1: Instead of the traditional approach where the user prompts the model and waits for it to interpret the context on its own
column2: ""Imposing-context"" directly dictates the model's output history. The model itself doesn't actually write the responses
column3: those are written by me.

column1: But when it looks at the chat history
column2: it mistakenly believes it generated those answers. This forces it to understand the user's intent. As you can see
column3: this approach gives amazing results. Gemini Flash 1.5 is not only able to analyze deepfakes but also achieves incredible accuracy.";API AI;ShynAI;Vietnam;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/everythingai-api

column1: Gaze Link;An eye-controlled communication system for ALS patients;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y_U1vkEC9PA;"Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis
column2: or ALS

column5: which has many limitations like cost and efficiency. Powered by the Google Gemini API
column6: my free multi-language app named ƒ??Gaze Linkƒ?? helps ALS patients communicate with their eyes independently

column1: First
column2: I recognize the userƒ??s face and eyes with Google ML Kit and OpenCV. After a 30-second calibration and setting adjustments
column3: the user can begin typing words on Gaze Linkƒ??s multi-language keyboard with 6 eye gestures. However
column4: eye-typing can be a very slow process for long sentences.

column1: To improve the text-entry rate
column2: I used a Gemini 1.5 Flash model to generate the patientƒ??s intended sentence based on keywords and the context. First
column3: Gaze Link will transcribe the caretakerƒ??s voice into text like ƒ??Is the room temperature ok?ƒ??. Then
column4: the patient will type keywords like ƒ??hot
column5: AC
column6: twoƒ?? with their eyes. The Gemini model will use the information to generate a suitable sentence like ƒ??I am hot
column7: can you turn the AC down by 2 degrees?ƒ?? in under a second. The model and keyboard also works with Spanish and Chinese. Experiments with 30 people show that the model can save up to 85% of user keystrokes and make Gaze Link 7x more effective than traditional E-transfer boards.";Android

column1: GBA - Proof of Concept;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ynrgLeXBTOI;"Generative Based Authentication (GBA) is an innovative authentication method developed by 4DA. This app is just a proof of concept and the emphasis is on the sign-in phase.
Hereƒ??s how it works:
Sign-Up Process:
Email Link: The user receives an email containing a link to a story generator powered by a Large Language Model (LLM)
column2: such as GPT.

column1: Story Creation: The user generates a story of their choice using the provided generator.
Story Approval: Once the user is satisfied with the story
column2: it is saved
column3: completing the sign-up process.

column1: Sign-In Process:
Email Submission: To sign in
column2: the user provides their registered email address.

column1: Story-Based Question: The system presents a question based on the unique story generated during sign-up.
Authentication: If the user correctly answers the question
column2: access is granted. If not
column3: access is denied.

column1: Additional Features:
Story Modification: Users can change their story at any time
column2: along with the way questions are generated and answered.

column1: Web-Based Convenience: The entire process is web-based
column2: eliminating the need for any extra app installations.

column1: Device Compatibility: Unlike many authentication apps like BankID
column2: which require modern smart devices and may no longer work on older devices
column3: GBA only requires access to a web browser
column4: ensuring broader compatibility and accessibility.";;Samuel Ferrer (CTO and developer)
column5: Alexei Martinez (CLO and assistant);Sweden;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/gba-proof-of-concept

column1: GEMINI AUTO BACKEND AI PROJECT;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mfiQpoPUO48;"What the app does is
column2: we first of all make a POST request to an endpoint that requires you to pass a query field in the request body. The query must be a collection name
column3: we then pass the query to a function that uses Gemini to generate code that fetches data in the specified collection by giving it a well structured prompt
column4: we then write the code generated by Gemini to a file
column5: then run a node child process to execute the code in the file
column6: after executing the code through the child node process
column7: we then pass the data to another function that uses Gemini to convert the code into a JSON and then finally return the data to the user. Our aim is not to just get data from collections but to also be able to post
column9: delete and patch data in a collection in the upcoming weeks. After that
column10: we want the query passed to the enpoint to be like for example ""I want to fetch all users
column11: I want to delete user with id 2""
column12: gemini will be able to generate a code that will be able to perform the above query.";Web/Chrome;Elijah Darkeh Agbedam and Augustine Love Stephens;Ghana;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/gemini-auto-backend-ai-project

column8: the resulting text is forwarded to the Chatbot Bridge.

column1: GEMINI_API_2;Unlock power of NASA's Apollo 11 mission data with cutting-edge RAG.;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cavIXXLJ42c;"GEMINI_API_2 is an innovative application designed to unlock and harness the wealth of information from NASA's Apollo 11 mission archives. Our app processes various types of multimodal data
column2: including text
column3: images
column4: video
column5: and audio files
column6: to provide comprehensive insights and summaries about the mission. By leveraging the powerful capabilities of the Gemini API
column7: GEMINI_API_2 offers users an efficient way to access and retrieve pertinent information from the vast NASA archives.

column1: Hereƒ??s how GEMINI_API_2 works:
Data Preparation: We start by collecting data from NASA's public archives related to the Apollo 11 mission
column2: including text documents
column3: images
column4: videos
column5: and audio files.

column1: Data Extraction and Summarization: Using Optical Character Recognition (OCR) with Tesseract
column2: our app extracts text from images. The extracted text is then fed into the Gemini API to generate concise and informative summaries tailored for efficient retrieval.

column1: Embedding Generation: The generated summaries are converted into vector embeddings using Gemini's Text Embedding Model. These embeddings numerically represent the summaries
column2: making them suitable for efficient similarity searches.

column1: Vector Database Creation: We store these embeddings in Chroma DB
column2: a vector database that enables fast and accurate retrieval of relevant documents based on similarity searches.

column1: Querying the RAG System: When a user queries the system
column2: GEMINI_API_2 retrieves the most relevant documents based on their embeddings.";Google Colaboratory;Dr. Kolapo;Nigeria;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/gemini-api-2

column1: GeminiSMS;Empowering you with Gemini
column2: no internet required.;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vmDmmSPaEu0;"The conversation around AI takes internet access for granted. But for most of the world
column3: the internet is prohibitively expensive. In fact
column4: some of the poorest countries in the world have the highest costs. This means that people who can benefit the most from AI and LLMs like Google Gemini
column5: are the least likely to be able to access it. That is why we came up with GeminiSMS. GeminiSMS gives you the power of Google Gemini
column6: without the internet. Whether you're looking to bridge the digital divide or enhance local innovation
column7: GeminiSMS aims to empower communities in even the most remote areas by offering Gemini via SMS.

column1: Steps:
SMS: The process begins when a user sends an SMS to a special number. This text message could be queries or information that the user wishes to use AI for.
Communications Client: The incoming SMS is received by a communications client
column2: which forwards the message to a server using a webhook. Gemini: The server uses Google Gemini to generate a response which is limited to 150 characters due to SMS limitations.

column1: Reply: The reply is then sent back to the user through the same communications client. Impact:
The project addresses a significant gap in digital access. GeminiSMS functions 100% offline for the users. This is useful in areas with unreliable or expensive internet services. Using SMS
column2: which is often available for cheaper prices even in remote locations
column3: GeminiSMS provides a way for people in remote areas to interact with cutting-edge AI technology.";;GeminiSMS;United States;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/geminisms

column1: GEMLINGO;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xFq89kX0N-k;GEMLINGO is your ultimate language learning companion. GEMLINGO tailors your experience to fit your unique goals and schedule. It is built with Flutter and uses Firebase for backend. With a simple registration process

column1: Gemoji;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bRTQgchzcC8;"I'm Gemoji
column2: an emoji translator.

column1: I can translate the statements you send into emoji and vice versa. I can also play emoji guessing games with you.
## Features
- Translate text to emoji.
- Translate emoji to text.
- Play emoji guessing games.
## dotEnv
You need to create a `.env` file in the root directory of the project. The `.env` file should contain the following variables:
GEMINI_API_KEY=''
The `GEMINI_API_KEY` variable is your Gemini API key. You can get your API key from the [AI Studio](https://aistudio.google.com).
## How to run the project
- Enter your Gemini API key in the `.env` file.
- Run `npm install` to install the dependencies.
- Run `npm run server` to start the server.
- Run `npm start` to start the client.
- Visit `http://localhost:3000` to access the client.
- Let's play some fun with Gemoji!";I will be using flutter to build iOS and android apps.;binhua.org;Japan;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/gemoji

column1: Giul-IA;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nsW7sFYutOg;giulIA was born from a reflection made almost forty years ago. Will machines ever be able to think and make autonomous decisions? But... what is thought? If I think or dream
column2: I do it in Italian. An Englishman
column3: however
column4: thinks in English. What if language was the mother of thought? At that time I thought that the key to everything was to be able to make a machine generate contextualized text. If the machine generates text
column5: could it think? I wondered... Maybe if the machine could convert images into text descriptions. Could it also think based on what it sees? Dragon Dictate could be used to convert words into text and give it as input. Could it therefore feel? But the time was not ripe. For almost forty years I have carried these questions with me
column6: cataloging them as pure science fiction. But here come the LLM models. They are exactly what I needed to test my ideas.GiulIA is a prototype of artificial intelligence.It generates text but processes it as if it were its own thought stimulated by a particular input
column8: the value of a sensor or even just the passage of time.This thought leads giulIA to decisions (also influenced by its current emotional state) on how to respond or what to do based on its own action list. If something is considered interesting
column9: Giul-IA will not hesitate to store it in its long-term memory.;;Francesco Bozzotta;Italy;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/giul-ia

column1: GL-AI;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8wIfQ0sPIr8;"The Power of Multi-Model Collaboration:
Imagine a chatbot where you can start a conversation with Gemini
column2: and then seamlessly switch over to ChatGPT or Llama or another language model
column3: who can pick up the thread and continue the conversation based on the previous model's understanding. This collaborative approach offers several exciting possibilities:

column1: Contextual Understanding: Each model can build upon the context established by the previous one. This allows for richer conversations where the chatbot's memory and understanding of the conversation flow consistently
column2: even as you switch models.

column1: Diverse Perspectives: Switching models lets you tap into different AI personalities and approaches. One model might be better at creative writing
column2: while another might excel at factual information. By combining them
column3: your app could offer a more rounded and insightful response.

column1: Improved Accuracy: By utilizing multiple models
column2: the app could potentially overcome the limitations of any one model
column3: leading to more accurate and reliable information.

column1: Technical Considerations:
Model Communication: You'll need a way to smoothly transfer the conversation's context from one model to the next. This requires clever technical solutions to ensure a seamless handover.
Model Consistency: Ensuring that the models respond in a consistent manner
column2: even with different personalities
column3: is a challenge. It will require careful training and tuning to minimize inconsistencies.";Android

column1: Glow Alarm;A visual alarm system for the deaf and hard of hearing.;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2ticysXQrvU;"GlowAlarm is a new mobile app developed for the deaf and hard of hearing.It was created to overcome the limitations of existing emergency alert systems. The core of GlowAlarm is to convert information that cannot be heard into visual signals. This allows users with hearing difficulties to quickly respond to emergency situations without missing critical information.
GlowAlarm works in conjunction with smart light bulbs. When an emergency occurs
column2: GlowAlarm immediately controls the connected smart bulbs. The bulbs emit light in various colors and flashing patterns depending on the severity and type of the situation. For example
column3: rapid red flashes signal immediate danger
column4: while slow yellow blinks indicate caution.

column1: GlowAlarm's key function is prioritizing disaster alerts and controlling bulbs accordingly. It distinguishes between non-urgent notifications like heat advisories and life-threatening alerts like earthquake warnings. We use Gemini API
column2: an LLM
column3: to automate this complex analysis and risk classification.

column1: We prioritized recall over precision
column2: as detecting all dangerous situations is crucial in safety-critical contexts. Recall measures how comprehensively actual dangers are detected. Through continuous prompt optimization with the Gemini API
column3: we maximized recall
column4: accepting cases where lower-level incidents might be classified as higher-level ones to ensure optimal safety. This approach minimizes the risk of missing any dangerous situations that could threaten user safety.";Flutter

column1: Gov Notes;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ARIxs8cir-g;"Gov Notes is a website that allows users to quickly understand lengthy government meetings. Users can search for specific committees or topics where they will eventually be taken to a hearing summary page. This page allows the user to scan for key points which they can click on to view the portion of the video where that key point is discussed. In addition
column2: this page contains a Gemini-powered chat where the user can ask follow up questions about the video to dive deeper. This chat enables users to ask when their current topic was discussed and be presented a direct link into the video.

column1: From a technical perspective
column2: Gov Notes analyzes government hearing transcripts using Geminiƒ??s generate_content and embed_content APIs as well as a Postgres PgVector DB for RAG. During pre-processing
column3: each generated key point is validated using RAG to ensure there exists a 30 second snippet of transcript text that serves as ƒ??evidenceƒ??
column4: dropping key points that fail validation to avoid spreading misinformation. The chat feature uses Geminiƒ??s ƒ??function callingƒ?? and a similar RAG process to hook into the chat
column5: handling all responses for direct timestamps in the video where the current chat topic was discussed. Sitewide search is implemented using a semantic similarity vector search over a weighted combination of all key points and transcript snippets. Performant search over hundreds of thousands of vectors is the result of carefully crafted SQL and an HNSW index over the vectors.";Web/Chrome
column6: GCP's Cloud Run
column7: Cloud SQL & Artifact Registry. YouTube Data API. Google Generative AI Embeddings Model. Also vids.google.com's Beta for the video submission.;Gov Notes / Jason Steving / Kenny Mayhue;United States;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/gov-notes

column1: GreenQuest-Utopia;The Green Game lets users design and evaluate a sustainable society.;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d9Jctjw1MGM;"EcoTopia: The Green Game is an interactive tool that allows users to design and evaluate their ideal sustainable society by adjusting various environmental characteristics. column1: GrubScore;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3S91Ve8tKGw;"GrubScore is a lightweight mobile app designed to help make healthier eating choices. The app enables a user to snap or upload a picture of their food and get instant feedback on how healthy the food actually is

column5: recommendations for similar food
column6: and possible allergens. If the food is unhealthy and scores low
column7: the response will include recommendations for healthy alternatives that are similar to the food pictured. If the food is healthy and scores high
column8: the response will commend the user for making healthy choices and recommend healthy foods that are similar to the food pictured.

column1: The recipe generation tab takes user defined allergens and/or dietary restrictions if applicable and with the help of the Gemini API

column1: GUI Dog;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8ihCqszq0as;"You want to access a specific file. For a sighted user
column2: you simply click to enter the Documents folder and click again to open the file. Done.

column1: But what if you're visually impaired? You'd use a blind reader
column2: such as macOS's VoiceOver. So you open a file manager window
column3: and VoiceOver describes
column4: in detail
column5: what it is and can do (every time you use it!). You use complex keyboard actions to navigate to the sidebar. Whenever you interact with your device
column6: VoiceOver repeats information about the focused UI element. You then go down the list of folders
column8: with VoiceOver announcing every folder's name until you finally hear the correct folder. The process is repeated inside the folder until you find your desired file. Wasn't that exasperating?

column1: A quiet two-click task turns into a yakking
column2: tiresome dozen-action operation.

column1: What if you could complete the same task simply by instructing
column2: ""In the Documents folder
column3: open my vaccination document""? My app
column4: GUI Dog
column5: does that.

column1: The user gives GUI Dog precise instructions for a task. GUI Dog provides Gemini with the task to achieve and a list of UI elements it can manipulate. Gemini then specifies what actions to take
column2: and GUI Dog uses the macOS accessibility system to execute them. Together
column3: they work towards completing the task.

column1: GUI Dog aims to be the ""seeing eye"" for the visually impaired
column2: using Large Language Model technologies to help uplift the disadvantaged
column3: enhancing their interactions with the digital world.";;Kaisol;Singapore;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/gui-dog

column1: Guru Intelligence;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xQj_PQ36cSo;"This application is a document analysis and question-answering system built on Next.js

column1: The app features five modes:
MCQ: Generates multiple-choice questions
Explain: Provides detailed explanations
Summarize: Creates concise summaries
Bullet Points: Extracts key points

column2: the system retrieves relevant document sections from Pinecone and uses Gemini 1.5 Flash API to generate tailored responses.

column1: HealthRanger;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pPsRJmvgm84;"There is a massive medical crisis going on in parts of India

column1: How Gemini AI powers HealthRanger?

column2: sentiment reports
column3: suggestions and alerts.

column1: History++ Browser Extension;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=z5CWkvpSm4g;"Imagine if you could search through everything youƒ??ve seen on your browser: not just the public websites available on Google
column2: but also your private web documents and notes
column3: internal business sites
column4: or even chats with AI bots. Imagine if you could save all that information privately and locally

column1: That is what we are creating: a private
column2: personalized search engine for everything a person has seen in their web browser. It is a browser extension with search
column3: history
column4: and chat.

column1: Our application features: semantic search over previously observed text
column2: AI chat
column3: powered by Gemini
column4: with search results as context
column5: as well as screen captures to make results more recognizable. In addition
column6: users can block URLs they donƒ??t want remembered. Best of all
column7: everything stored is local on the device: screen captures are saved to OPFS
column8: embeddings are created with ONNX models
column9: and text and vectors are saved in the browser using a WASM SQL vector database. Our combination of ONNX models and Vector DB provide KNN search results over tens of millions of words in under a second
column10: translating to years of browsing history. Did we mention this is all local on-device? That means both private and with zero cloud costs.

column1: For the Chat feature which rounds it all out

column1: ImagiCraft (Prompt Helper);Visual first support for image generation AI prompt engineering.;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KKE58ERT-3k;"Our app is a cutting-edge Prompt Helper designed to simplify the creation of high-quality prompts for generative AI
column2: with a focus on image generation. Users can easily select from a diverse array of pre-researched prompt templates
column3: each paired with illustrations
column4: to craft custom prompts. These can be directly used with popular AI tools like Midjourney
column5: Sora
column6: Canva

column1: A standout feature of our app is the use of the Gemini API to power two key functionalities: Grouping and Expansion.
Grouping Functionality: When users compile multiple prompt elements
column2: it can often be challenging to communicate the precise relationships between these elements to the AI. Our app uses the Gemini API to intelligently group and reorganize these prompt elements into cohesive sentences. This ensures that the AI understands how the components relate to one another
column3: leading to more accurate and coherent outputs.

column1: img-alt-text-webpack-plugin;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EM_jCBu25O8;"My plugin works with webpack which is common build tool for deploying web applications. It detects elements without 'alt' attribute in output files emitted to build directory by webpack and auto-inserts the 'alt' text in elements using Gemini. It also injects javascript into the webpage which fetches 'alt' text for all images that are loaded dynamically on client side by other scripts embedded in the page. Bottom line: It will make sure that all images in the webpage have 'alt' text available.

This improves accessibility of web and improves SEO while cutting down on developer time spent thinking about appropriate text string to insert for alt attribute. This plugin has been put out as an npm package and requires minimal configuration which makes it a breeze to set-up and use.";Web/Chrome;sam1git;Canada;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/img-alt-text-webpack-plugin

column1: Infergram;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S5FUggn2u0g;"Infergram is an exciting multiplayer guessing game that combines the fun of word games with the power of AI image analysis. In this real-time online game
column2: players join virtual rooms to compete against each other in guessing AI-generated descriptions of images.

column1: Here's how it works:
- Players can create or join game rooms
- At the start of each round
column2: the server selects a random image from the database.

column1: - The Gemini API analyzes this image and generates a concise description.
- Players are presented with a hidden version of this description
- As the timer counts down
column2: players type their guesses into the chat.

column1: - Correct word guesses are revealed in real-time
column2: and players earn points based on speed and accuracy.

column1: - After all rounds are completed
column2: the player with the highest score wins.

column1: We used Gemini API to:
- Analyze the selected image and generate a descriptive text.
- Fine-tune the description to be concise (4-8 words) and use simple
column2: commonly understood language.

column1: - Ensure descriptions are unique and varied.
By leveraging Gemini's advanced image understanding capabilities
column2: Infergram creates a dynamic and unpredictable gaming experience. The AI-generated descriptions challenge players to think creatively and interpret images in new ways
column3: making each round fresh and exciting.";Web/Chrome

column1: InnerQuest;Using AI to help teenagers evaluate and identify their emotions.;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nBWtqJV0ATw;"Since we are teenagers

column1: Innocent Old Lady;Innocent Old Lady: Outsmarting scammers by wasting their time;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7cUr6fOL2FA;"Innocent Old Lady is an innovative anti-scam application designed to protect potential victims from fraud by cleverly wasting scammersƒ?? time. column3: our system seamlessly takes over the call
column4: simulating a conversation that mirrors the typical phases of a scam: Problem
column5: Manipulation
column6: and Extraction. By intelligently analyzing the scammerƒ??s speech using the Gemini API
column7: Milena responds in a way that prolongs the interaction
column8: effectively stalling the scammer. This not only prevents them from targeting others during that time but also increases their operational costs
column9: making the scamming process less profitable.

column1: In its first week of operation

column3: demonstrating the practical impact of the system. The Gemini APIƒ??s rapid text-to-speech and natural language processing capabilities ensure that the responses are timely and convincing
column4: making it an ideal solution for real-time scam prevention. Innocent Old Lady represents a new approach to cybersecurity-one that turns the tables on scammers by using their own tactics against them. Our goal is to deploy this technology widely

InsideOut;Discover safe choices with InsideOut - Scan and know your products!;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dIGPrgI7Dho;"How does InsideOut Work?
It's super simple to use. Just open the app and snap a photo of any product label or ingredient list. InsideOut gets to work right away
column2: breaking down all that confusing information into something you can actually understand. But here's where it gets really cool. InsideOut also provides an option where you can choose to provide details about yourself or your preferences. Things like:

column1: - Do you have any allergies?
- Are you on a special diet
column2: like keto or vegan?

column1: - Do you have any health conditions InsideOut should know about?
Once you've told InsideOut a bit about yourself
column2: InsideOut becomes your personal food and product detective. Every time you scan something
column3: it doesn't just tell you what's in it - it tells you if it's good for YOU.

column1: Let's say you're allergic to peanuts and you scan a granola bar. InsideOut will immediately warn you if there are peanuts or peanut traces in it. Or maybe you're trying to cut down on sugar. InsideOut will let you know if that ""healthy"" snack is actually a sugar bomb in disguise.
Making Sense of What You See
We know that sometimes you just want a quick yes or no. That's why we use a simple color and number system:
- Green means go! This product is great for you.
- Yellow means be careful. It might not be the best choice.
- Red means stop and think twice. This product could be bad for you.
The numbers work the same way
column2: from 1 (watch out!) to 5 (all good!). It's like having a traffic light for your shopping cart.";Flutter
column3: Android
column4: Firebase;Megabyte;India;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/insideout

column1: IRIS 1;From Damage Control to Damage Prevention;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WRx_03QeXAc;"Iris transforms the way people and businesses censor sensitive data in mass.
Millions of users share videos on social media everyday. However
column2: the current system struggles to detect and remove sensitive information in real-time. Videos containing passwords and personally identifiable information (PII) like addresses
column3: credit card details and IDs are frequently taken down only after user reports
column4: which can be too late since the information has already been leaked.

column1: This is where Iris steps in. By analyzing visual data for any sensitive data leaks before the video is published
column2: we can solve the problem at its source.

column1: Here's how it works: Clients upload their videos through an API request. These videos are encrypted in Firebase
column2: processed on GCP
column3: and analyzed for sensitive info. Our internal database of sensitive info is collected only on the consent of our users
column4: who receive a decrease in their subscription fee. This data will then be deleted after a 30 day retention period. A report is generated
column5: allowing clients to customize blur settings. Finally
column6: IRIS returns a censored video with requested PII blurred.

column1: We use Google Gemini 1.5 Pro to analyze any potential information leak. Additionally
column2: we use RAG to retrieve any matches to our internal sensitive ino database. Google Gemini allows us to detect sensitive data from a semantic perspective. So more complex cases of PII and password leakage like mirrored or occluded texts can also be detected.";Web/Chrome
column3: Firebase;Iris;United States;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/iris-1

column1: IslamChat;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_0iAwApeEwI;"Building an AI religious counsellor
column2: especially one that can emulate a Muslim Imam
column3: has been a notoriously difficult challenge. The developer will be held spiritually responsible for the user being misled by hallucinations. Most abandon the task rather than take the risk.

column1: We use Gemini to get around this challenge in a clever way. We have built a RAG app over a dataset of 145k questions on Islamic jurisprudence answered by reputable human scholars. Gemini does three things in different parts of the pipeline:
1) Expands the pool of questions by translating questions into Arabic such that we can also retrieve Arabic-language vector embeddings
2) Condenses the chat history into a standalone question such that we can keep our prompts small
3) Tailors the responses to the user based on their question and the data retrieved. We have extremely strict guardrails such that anything outside this dataset is not answered at all
column2: and all answers are cited and linked by source down to the school of thought (madhab) and scholar
column3: thanks to Gemini.

column1: From our logs (Google Cloud Logging)
column2: we have found that most users ask variations of the most common questions that have been answered by humans already many times. This is ideal
column3: as Gemini can focus on making that existing data conversational!";Web/Chrome
column4: Google Cloud Platform;deen.ai;UK;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/islamchat

column1: ItinerAI;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fiGCWxLx9Dc;"ItinerAI is designed for travelers who want to explore new places without the hassle of extensive planning. It creates a complete itinerary for your chosen location

column1: Upon receiving trip details

column4: ensuring they align with user preferences by analyzing the nature of the activities and reviews.

column5: trip duration
column6: and logistics to create a detailed day-by-day plan. The output is a deeply nested JSON that includes reasoning and explanations

column1: Journey Hub;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q9HH2ce8g8k;"In the Journey Hub App

column1: Knowledge Gem;Tests knowledge on various topics.;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PSUe2zZHBtA;"In the Question input box enter which topic you want to take the test and select how many questions you want. column2: generationConfig: GenerationConfig(responseMimeType: 'application/json'. App will make a request to the Gemini model with number of question
column3: topic and the question model then Gemini will respond with the questions in json format. That json format will be used as the test. The prompt used for getting questions from the model:

column1: prompt: 'Give $_selectedValue ${_questionsController.text} questions and options with answers in json with format $kFormat and different data on each time'
where _selectedValue is the value selected by the user and _questionController.text is the topic entered by the user and kFormat is the json format defined developer(me).
Without Gemini to achieve this we need to setup a backend with database and server and api calls but with Gemini we don't need any of that.
This just a demo for what we can do with Gemini
column2: Any app which needs to get data from backend can be replaced with Gemini (we need to fine tune model according to our need).";Flutter;Jagadeesh;India;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/knowledge-gem

column5: and questions about the generated texts. The prompts Gemini receives ensure the question and level are similar to previous questions of a common Korean test. It also uses Gemini to detect difficult words in the generated texts and provide definitions that are contextually relevant

column1: Label Lens;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KzDLcl47LGI;"Label Lens is a mobile app that decodes product ingredient lists using AI. It empowers consumers to make informed choices about the products they use and consume. Here's how Label Lens works and utilizes the Gemini API:

column1: LangFlip;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_YsfN3WEGLg;"Langflip relies heavily on the Gemini Multimodal API. It will send the original video to Gemini and ask Gemini to :
1. Generate captions for the videos
column2: one of the main complexities of translating videos is maintaining the rhythm of the original video. For example
column3: if we want to translate an English video into German
column4: it is very likely that the translation will have more words and will be longer than the original video. Gemini gives the ability to detect when the speaker takes a break and group the caption until a break.

column1: 2. Generate the translations
column2: again
column3: we want to maintain the rhythm of the original videos. Google Translate will provide a literal translation of the original sentences. However
column4: we want translations that are more or less the same length as the original video. Gemini gives the ability to generate translations with more or less the same number of characters than the original sentence translated.

column1: 3. Detect which frames need to be lip-synced
column2: we want to send only the frames where the speaker is clearly visible and talking to the lip-syncing AI model. If we send frames with no visible face to the AI
column3: it might crash and fail the lip-syncing process. Gemini provides the ability to send the video and receive all the timestamps where the speaker appears in the video.";Flutter
column4: Firebase;Rš?my Menard;France;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/langflip

column1: LexCelerate;Accelerate Legal Research
column2: Win Cases Faster;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yTYUQ2n0iGg;"LexCelerate is an AI-powered tool accelerating legal research

column4: focusing initially on Singaporean cases.

column1: We integrate the Gemini API for two key purposes:
1. Vector Embeddings Generation: Transforming our legal dataset into high-dimensional numerical representations.
2. Query Vectorization: Converting user questions into the same high-dimensional space.
These vector representations enable efficient similarity searches against our indexed content
column2: quickly identifying the most relevant information.

column1: Top matching results are passed to our QA model
column2: which synthesizes the information into a tailored natural language response. This approach accelerates the search experience
column3: delivering precise and contextually relevant answers to complex legal questions.

column1: By combining the Gemini API with our pre-trained model
column2: we've created a system that rapidly navigates vast amounts of legal information
column3: providing insights in a fraction of the time of traditional methods.

column1: LexCelerate aims to revolutionize legal research
column2: allowing lawyers to focus on higher-value tasks like case strategy and client consultation
column3: ultimately improving the efficiency and effectiveness of legal services.";Google Cloud Run;LexCelerate;Singapore;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/lexcelerate

column1: MantisGem;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PwykrMWl1jQ;"Our app remedies a common problem that most users of LLMs face. Many users are interested in getting recommendations for activities or exploring options that are suitable to their specific needs given their general preferences or particular circumstances at the moment when they are querying. However
column2: they are often stuck with responses that are too generic to serve their specific needs.

column1: A skilled human assistant would remedy this as follows: ask them pertinent questions that help them to narrow their options
column2: and gather information that may not be directly relevant but could help understand the user's thought process. The former relates to flipped interactions and chain-of-thought prompting
column3: which have been areas where AI has advanced significantly. The latter
column4: on the other hand
column5: relates to tools from cognitive psychology and behavioral analysis.

column1: We have utilized the ability of Gemini to perform the former
column2: where we take the user's queries and combine it with a request to perform flipped interactions. This is done through API calls. The latter is more delicate and not straightforward
column3: and hence we have used several handpicked training examples designed using a combination of Gemini and ideas inspired by the psychology literature. Thus our model utilizes innate abilities of Gemini and questioning patterns suggested by the examples to direct the conversation with the user in a way that best extracts relevant information from the user and guides them to the desirable output.";Web/Chrome
column4: Google Docs & Google Drive;No Veni Vedi Vici

column1: Below are the details of how Gemini has been used:

column2: which is an AI agent build using Gemini API.

Verify and confirm the result 6. Summarize the result and explain the final outcome 7. Conclusion.""

column1: MERLIN;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w-OsVsw_roY;"MERLIN is an innovative video search platform that revolutionizes video content discovery and access. By ingeniously combining Gemini Flash and Vertex multimodal embedding techniques
column2: MERLIN delivers a seamless and intuitive video search experience tailored precisely to your intent.

column1: At its core
column2: MERLIN integrates large language models and cutting-edge multimodal embeddings. When you submit an initial text query
column3: our backend extracts the query embedding and performs a vector search against pre-computed video embeddings. However
column4: if the results don't quite hit the mark
column5: you can engage in a natural conversation with MERLIN
column6: powered by Gemini Flash.

column1: As you converse
column2: MERLIN leverages Vertex to extract multimodal embeddings from the dialogue
column3: capturing the nuanced context of your needs. These are interpolated with the initial query embedding
column4: and a new vector search is performed against the video database.

column1: Throughout this process
column2: vector embeddings and metadata are seamlessly stored in Firestore
column3: while the actual videos and thumbnails reside in Firebase
column4: ensuring a smooth and responsive experience.

column1: By harnessing the combined power of Gemini Flash's conversational AI and Vertex's multimodal capabilities
column2: MERLIN truly understands your video search intent like never before
column3: surfacing the most relevant and accurate results.

column1: This Project is derived from our work MERLIN: Multimodal Embedding Refinement via LLM-based Iterative Navigation for Text-Video Retrieval-Rerank Pipeline.";Web/Chrome
column2: Firebase
column3: Python;MERLIN: Your Intelligent video search companion;South Korea;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/merlin

column1: Mind Incepted Art;MIA uses brain waves to generate highly personal and unique art.;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rPFqRHgp7P8;"MIA captures theta waves from the brain and generates art from it.
You need to record brain signals using EEG electrodes (and a single channel EEG capture device ---> https://www.instructables.com/Recording-EEG-From-Visual-Cortex-of-Brain-Using-Bi/).

column1: MLChatAgent;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ksgMQXnCxfQ;"The app is designed to help users interact with complex machine learning (ML) models effortlessly. It simplifies understanding and working with ML models by allowing users to ask questions and receive detailed
column2: comprehensible answers in English.

column1: Using the Gemini chat agent
column2: the app employs several tools to address user questions:

column1: - question_reformer: Reformulates questions for clarity.
- generate_sql: Generates SQL queries
- execute_sql: Executes queries and summarizes data.
- subset_churn_contribution_analysis: Performs churn contribution analysis on subsets
- subset_clv_analysis: Evaluates CLV impact based on treatments done on subsets selected.
- subset_shap_summary: Provides insights behind predictions and next best actions.
- customer_recommendations: Suggests ways to reduce churn for individuals.
- model_stat: Answers model-related questions.
- generate_visualizations: Creates visual data representations.
All these tools are individual agents powered by Gemini models
Here's how the app works:
- User Interaction: Users ask questions in plain English.
- Planning: The agent identifies necessary tools and plans the execution.
- Translation: The agent reframes questions into concise instructions.
- Model Interaction: The agent executes the plan using ML models.
- User Response: The agent interprets and delivers responses in plain English.
This agentic framework empowers business users to fully leverage ML models and data without needing highly technical skills.";Web/Chrome

column1: Muse Diary;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lcMANrDdTSw;"Muse Diary is an journaling app that blends AI conversation
column2: music recommendations
column3: and self-reflection tools. Built on Google Cloud Platform with Gemini AI.

column1: *Key Features:
1. AI Chat Journaling: Converse naturally with Gemini AI to log your day.
2. Traditional Writing: Standard interface for classic journaling.
3. Music Mood Matching: AI-suggested tunes based on your entries.
4. Visual Emotion Calendar: Entries organized with mood-representing album art.
5. AI Insights: Uncover life patterns and significant moments.
*Tech Stack:
- Backend: Spring Boot (Docker)
- Hosting: Google Cloud Run
- Auth & Storage: Firebase
- AI: Gemini (Vertex API)
- Version Control & CI/CD: GitHub
- Cross-Platform: Flutter
- Music Data: YouTube API
*How the App Runs:
1. Input sent to Cloud Run server
2. Server processes (using Vertex API if needed)

column4: healthy cell
column5: or dead cell
column6: thus aiding pathologists in diagnostics. Various models were trained to automatically classify hematoxylin and eosin-stained whole slide images and tissue microarrays

column1: Plato's Playground;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=USdV9mQx4UA;"My app teaches young children how to count to 31 on one hand using the binary number system. column1: PRISM;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E5g44pSQL3U;The PRISM application is geospatial intelligence tool. We generate high fidelity 3D scenes of large areas using radiance fields and then display these onto an interactive web viewer. This gives the user an unprecedented ability to freely explore the 3D representation of the real world. This radiance field technique not only provides a visual boost compared to existing 3D maps but also is generated much quicker allowing for more frequent updating. The real power of the tool comes in when using large multi-modal AI models like Gemini to extract insights from the scene. We have used the Gemini api to allow users to essentially chat with the visible world. User are able to navigate to anywhere in the scene and ask questions about what they are looking at to quickly gather insights that traditionally required an imagery analyst to obtain. Users can ask questions about tree types

column1: Project Stargate;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9x7_PHop30o;Project Stargate the AI application is an early prototype for an automated evaluation system (or just a fun sketching/guessing game!) currently stargate utilises the Gemini model to simulate the role of a monitor within a remote viewing session - the monitor in a remote viewing session guides a viewer through a session

column1: Prompt Compress;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z2J1-nI9uZo;Prompt Compress is a tool designed to optimize LLM prompts for efficiency and cost-effectiveness. Its main function is to reduce the number of tokens in a prompt while preserving its core meaning and intent. This is important because many AI models charge based on token usage. It takes a prompt and lets users specify an optimization pipeline with industry best techniques for reducing tokens while preserving the meaning of the prompt. It then sanity checks the LLM response to the compressed prompt and provides an analysis of it when compared to the original input. Prompt Compress uses Gemini at every stage as the input prompt is transformed to gather responses
column2: token counts
column3: and then to perform analysis.;Web/Chrome

column1: PwnPatrol;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7rVfKtWh6c8;"Our app automates the responsible disclosure process by performing thorough CVE (Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures) analysis
column2: generating and testing search dorks

column1: Upon receiving a CVE identifier
column2: the app begins by analyzing the CVE details using the Gemini API
column3: which helps determine if the CVE is dorkable. If so
column4: the app uses Gemini to generate relevant Google and Shodan dorks tailored to the CVE characteristics. These dorks are then tested to identify vulnerable websites and systems.

column1: For each identified vulnerable entity
column2: the app extracts information such as domain names and performs OSINT to gather data on associated companies and their key cybersecurity personnel. This is done using tailored queries to search engines
column3: and the Gemini API assists in summarizing and interpreting the search results.

column4: forums

column1: rss-summarizer;rss-feed-generator;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-vYDUcN8kmk;"Certainly! Here's a concise summary including the use of the Gemini API for creating the RSS generator:
**Creating an RSS Generator Using Gemini API**
This project involves building an RSS generator that automatically creates XML-based RSS feeds. These feeds provide updates on new content
column2: such as blog posts or news articles
column3: from a specific website.

column1: ### Key Components:
1. **Understanding RSS Feeds:**
- RSS feeds are XML files that list updates from a website
column2: including titles
column3: links
column4: descriptions
column5: and publication dates.

column1: 2. **Using Gemini API:**
- The Gemini API is employed to fetch content from the website. This API simplifies retrieving structured data
column2: making it easier to parse and format for the RSS feed.

column1: 3. **Generating the RSS Feed:**
- The fetched data is structured into an XML format following the RSS 2.0 specification. Key elements like `<item>`
column2: `<title>`
column3: `<link>`
column4: and `<description>` are populated with the latest content.

column1: 4. **Automation and Hosting:**
- The process is automated to update the RSS feed regularly. The XML file is hosted on a web server
column2: allowing users and RSS readers to access the latest updates.

column1: This method provides a streamlined way to keep subscribers informed about new content
column2: leveraging the Gemini API for efficient data retrieval.";docker;chae;South Korea;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/rss-summarizer

column1: SAKE PAIRING;An AI-powered sake pairing service;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M3RNHLtFBzQ;"Overview
This application is an AI service that pairs Japanese sake or chu-hi with selected dishes. For Japanese sake
column2: it suggests two types
column3: and for chu-hi
column4: it recommends two flavors.

column1: Background
While there are various types of Japanese sake and chu-hi
column2: there are very few services or individuals capable of providing appropriate pairings. This aspect has somewhat remained a black box. Recently
column3: the number of foreign visitors to Japan has exceeded 3 million per month. This service was created to introduce these visitors to the enjoyment of Japanese alcohol
column4: especially those unfamiliar with it.

column1: Gemini API Specifications
In this service
column2: the type of alcohol and the dish image selected by the user are sent to the Gemini API. The API processes the image
column3: generates a description of the appropriate type of alcohol for the dish using LLM data
column4: and displays the result in the UI. The output is designed to be easy to understand
column5: with markdown formatting for clarity. This service leverages Gemini's strength as a multimodal LLM
column6: allowing for quick and accurate image processing. To achieve a balance between speed and quality
column7: we opted for Gemini 1.5 Flash. After comparing various LLMs and checking the accuracy (validity) of the pairing suggestions
column8: Gemini was found to have the highest precision
column9: with an impressive accuracy rate of 96.25% (77 correct pairings out of 80). This is a unique service that showcases the strengths of Gemini and offers something only AI can provide.";;Team Ss;Japan;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/sake-pairing

column1: SANT AR;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p2RuYfF01ag;"Our app allows kids to assemble SCABO cardboard toys with 3D detailed instructions. Then

column1: SB-AI (Select Better AI);;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E_G9SpgWyvA;"As large language models (LLMs) are integrated into more services

column1: SF-agent;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3VBE_1CZjNk;"SF-agent: Intelligent Video Content Search
SF-agent is an advanced search tool for finding specific video content. It uses a repository of embedded video subtitles and a database of subtitle timestamps and video identifiers.
How it works:
User submits a search query
Query is embedded and converted to a vector
System compares this vector with stored subtitle vectors
Most similar subtitles are identified
Corresponding video timestamps and numbers are retrieved
The SF-agent then provides users with the exact location of relevant content
column2: eliminating manual searching.

column1: Key Features:
Efficient: Quickly locates specific video segments
Accurate: Uses advanced embedding for precise matching
Versatile: Handles various query types
Gemini API Integration:
We integrated the Gemini API to refine user queries
column2: addressing diverse search behaviors. Users may input keywords
column3: use complete sentences
column4: or have limited video content knowledge. Our custom prompt:

column1: Takes the initial user query
References it against stored subtitle files
Generates a more specific version
This refined query is used for searching
column2: yielding more accurate results.

column1: Benefits:
Enhanced search experience
Efficient location of precise video segments
Accommodates various user familiarity levels and query styles
SF-agent transforms video content search
column2: making it faster
column3: more accurate
column4: and user-friendly.";;Aigenda;South Korea;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/sf-agent

column1: Smoothy;Prototype for displaying generative AI output using geolocated AR.;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IR8vWOo3N-g;"Smoothy is a prototype for displaying generative AI output using geolocated AR.

I wanted to find the right context and task where both the output values from generative AI and the physical locations in geolocated AR would be explored together. A travel-assist app made perfect sense for this
column2: and I chose Harvard Bridge that connects Boston and Cambridge/MIT with its painted smoot markers. (For details on ""smoot""
column3: please see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Smoot)

column1: In the Smoothy prototype
column2: Gemini API is given a smoot marker number along the bridge
column3: and is asked to return some relevant info with respect to MIT and that number. Geospatial Creator + Aero is then used to display the info at the location of the corresponding smoot marker.

column1: Please note that
column2: in the current version
column3: Aero is not able to accept live external assets or data. Therefore I had to prototype this as 2 separate processes where I first generated the info then secondly created suitable assets for Geospatial Creator + Aero. A real-time version would be possible with Aero if a future version allows for live data access.";ARCore;Jung-Hoon Seo;United States;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/smoothy

column1: Stoqs;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9BfhVzAmGe4;"Stoqs is a financial insights and research platform with a unique generative experience. The application offers a beautiful UI and a streamlined UX
column2: allowing users to conduct financial research in multiple threads or use specific companies or news as context for a conversation. We use LLMs as agents to collect
column3: collate and summarize high quality data beyond general search or crawling. Agents decompose queries and plan retrieval from trusted sources - whether it's analyses
column4: raw stats or visualizations. Using Retrieval Augmented Generation indexed SEC Filings
column5: news and earning call transcripts
column6: you get almost insider-level information for your queries.

column1: We adopted an approach to query decomposition specifically for the financial domain. Financial queries typically exhibit interdependencies that require careful planning and resolution. Our decomposition strategy involves a central orchestrator called the Answer & Visual Planner which focuses on breaking down queries into dependent and independent sub-queries
column2: but also on preemptively addressing complex visual requirements. The system iteratively resolves downstream dependencies
column3: processing each sub-query until all dependencies are fully resolved. Upon completion
column4: the orchestrator aggregates the results
column5: collating all textual and visual elements. Our response module synthesizes the information into a coherent output.

column1: Gemini powers our product by allowing us to work with a wide variety of data streams and large context windows.";Web/Chrome

column1: Stryvin;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OkzEhucwCfM;"Fitness coaches can convert a static PDF or Excel training plan into a dynamic one that automatically adapts to the abilities and performance of each client.

We use Gemini to extract all the training data (exercise variables and their values) from a PDF or Excel file. Gemini then helps us to generate and augment workout-related data to assign a more granular training volume
column2: intensity and load data when personalizing for end users.

column1: For end users
column2: we use Gemini to generate a Body Goal Predictor that tells them how long it will take to reach their goals based on the body composition information (body fat and muscle levels) extracted from a selfie.

column1: Consumers can find out their fat and muscle levels for free and have greater access to professional and personalized athlete-like training plans at 90% less cost.

We aim to provide high-quality and faster-progress fitness training plans to lower income populations that correlate with the obese population. We also want to prove that Gen AI is not a threat to replace coaches
column2: but that AI can benefit coaches by including them in the market and making their work more profitable and efficient.";Web/Chrome

column4: Google Cloud Platform;Fabio Reyes & Edwin Reyes;Colombia;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/stryvin

- Fail path for the whole quest (+ motivational talk)

column1: Tiger[A]Eye;It is a professional tool for researchers to help find cure for NBIA.;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HcPQj2qaAOM;"Tiger[A]Eye@Gemini is a cutting-edge research assistant designed specifically for researchers and doctors working on Neurodegeneration with Brain Iron Accumulation (NBIA). Our research assistant aims to expedite research into NBIA
column2: a cluster of rare
column3: inherited neurodegenerative disorders that predominantly affect children aged 7-15
column4: leading to severe impairment of the brain and nervous system. Within a year of onset
column5: mobility becomes severely limited
column6: and the condition can be fatal within three years.

column1: Our team has gathered an extensive dataset dedicated to NBIA

column3: making it the most comprehensive dataset available for this disease. This resource was developed almost entirely using the capabilities of Gemini.

column1: Distinct from existing large language models

column3: it can cite exact publications
column4: down to specific paragraphs or websites
column5: ensuring transparency in the source of the information. Moreover
column6: our assistant can suggest relevant follow-up queries based on ongoing research and supports text-to-speech for interactive conversations.

column1: Tiger[A]Eye@Gemini is built on a foundation of scientific accuracy
