column1: Toebeans;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xxcG2E6CBlY;"Toebeans is a fun app for getting different types of fortunes for your pet cat. It can generate paw readings
column2: horoscopes
column3: tell you about their past lives
column4: and you can ask it some predefined questions. The app is currently a work-in-progress
column5: and is planned to be released in the fall. Toebeans is a Compose Multiplatform app that targets both Android and iOS. On the Android side it uses MediaPipe's object detection to detect the cats paws either by consuming the camera feed or from a selected image.

column1: Once we have a picture of the paw (toebeans) the user can then get different fortunes for their cat. On Android it uses VertexAI and Gemini to generate the response from the given fortune prompt. On iOS it uses Firebase Functions to call the Gemini API. This is done because currently the VertexAI package for iOS is written in swift and not compatible with Kotlin Multiplatform. Toebeans also uses Firebase Remote Config to be able to adjust the prompt parameters and model settings remotely. As well as Firebase Auth for user authentication (currently disabled).
The user is also able to ""modify"" their original fortune response to a different type. The app then takes the original response and tells Gemini to rewrite it in a different style.
The plan for the future is to use GenKit instead of VertexAI and Firebase functions. We are also in the process of tuning a Gemini model by using the AI studio.";Android

column3: Mediapipe;Toebeans;Canada;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/toebeans

column1: Trouble Painter - Drawing Mafia Game;A game to find a Trouble painter by drawing.;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=i7pinXoKMIY;"Trouble Painter is a drawing Mafia game where players must identify the Trouble Painter hidden among the Good Painters through a ""Continue the Drawing"" challenge.
How to Play:
1. Gather 3 to 10 players.
2. A drawing keyword and one Trouble Painter are randomly assigned:
- Trouble Painter: Draws without knowing the keyword and tries to avoid detection.
- Good Painter: Draws based on the keyword and must keep it hidden from the Trouble Painter.
3. The game has two rounds
column2: with each player adding one stroke per turn.

column1: 4. After all drawings are done
column2: players vote to identify the Trouble Painter.

column1: 5. If the Trouble Painter is identified
column2: they get a chance to guess the keyword.

column1: 6. If they guess correctly
column2: the Trouble Painter wins. If not
column3: the Good Painters win.

column1: The app features an AI Hint function using Gemini's Vision capability to assist the Trouble Painter in guessing the keyword:
1. Players' drawings and the keyword are analyzed by Gemini.
2. Gemini generates a context-based hint.
3. The hint is provided to the Trouble Painter.
This feature enhances the game by:
1. Adjusting difficulty for the Trouble Painter.
2. Adding fun through Geminiƒ??s interpretation of the drawings.";Flutter

column2: ;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7SEa9hpM79A;"Our app leverages the Gemini API to generate customized stories based on user input. Here's how we use it:

column1: Story Suggestions: When a user selects a genre
column2: the app queries the Gemini API to fetch relevant story suggestions. We provide the API with a prompt specifying the genre and request a list of potential story types.

column1: Story Generation: Once a user selects a story type
column2: the app sends a request to the Gemini API to generate the complete story. The prompt includes details about the chosen genre and story type
column3: ensuring that the generated content is aligned with user preferences.

column1: Content Formatting: The API returns the story in a JSON format. We then process this JSON response to extract the story title and content. The story is formatted into paragraphs with appropriate punctuation to enhance readability and facilitate text-to-speech (TTS) functionality.
Error Handling and Duplication Prevention: We handle potential errors and ensure that the generated content is unique. If the API response contains errors or duplicates
column2: we retry the request or fetch new suggestions to provide fresh and engaging content.

column1: The Gemini API's advanced language model enables us to offer a diverse range of stories
column2: ensuring that users receive creative and unique narratives every time they interact with our app.";Android

column1: Ultra GPT PRO(Gemini);;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nMqEkBG3qpw;This Web Application Serves as a Virtual H.R Recruiter/Interviewer for Candidates seeking for job employment in different industries e.g. Full Stack Development and Data Science and many more fields. column1: Virtual Spokesperson (MVP);;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zOPiOYQElKg;"It's a backend that receives text from speech of phone call
column2: transforms into actions and execute those actions. The flow is:

column1: - User call the number and give it a action (""Call the local pharmacy and check if they have headache medicine"")
- The system
column2: using Gemini API
column3: asks all the needed informations for the action (like names
column4: phone numbers
column5: address...)

column1: - When the system has all the info
column2: the call ends

column1: - Then the system review the call (using Gemini API) and transform into actions (and take notes from important info)
- After that
column2: the system execute the action (make a outbound call) and talk to target person of action

column1: - When the system get the information needed to consider the action completed
column2: the outbound call ends

column1: - Finally
column2: the system call the user back with the summary from the action

column1: The gemini API is used to process all the text/chat:
- The text from the phone call
- The reasoning for reviewing and transforming the chat into actions
- The reasoning for reviewing and transforming the chat into notes
- The reasoning for reviewing and transforming the chat into summary for the return call";Firebase;Felippe Gallo;Brazil;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/virtual-spokesperson-mvp

Virtualismo Song Avatar 3D;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Vsz8shBOq8E;"Our application uses information from songs that have been processed using Google Gemini to extract the text and separate it into paragraphs. column1: VivaEval;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-Da-MmWUcz8;"VivaEval is designed to improve the lives of middle and high school teachers. It automates the testing and evaluation process with a type of test / assignment that cannot be easily compromised by readily available LLMs. This should save our overworked teachers 5-10 hours per week.
When the test begins
column2: VivaEval asks the student (or user) a question and awaits a response. At this point
column3: the app uses Gemini 1.5 Pro to:

column1: 1. Create the transcript of the audio input. (I didnƒ??t use the audio input directly since itƒ??s easier/faster to keep track of the entire conversation via text).

2. Conduct a sanity check to ensure that the user is not trying to access the prompt or say something irrelevant. 3. Come up with a response to the user's input; considering the conversation so far and the test outline given by the teacher.
The response is then synthesized to an audio file. When the user is done answering all questions
column2: they are prompted to hit ƒ??End Conversationƒ??. At this point the app has 1or 2 calls to the Gemini 1.5 Pro API to: 1. Go through the transcript of the conversation and the grading rubric; and assign a score for each point that was supposed to be covered in each question. Then compile the results into a json.

column1: 2. On some occasions the ƒ??jsonƒ?? created in the previous point is not ƒ??parsableƒ??; and so the app asks Gemini to correct the json structure.
Looking ahead
column2: I plan to incorporate audio and video analysis into VivaEval to further enhance academic integrity.";Web/Chrome
column3: Firebase
column4: Google Cloud Storage
column5: Google Cloud Text-To-Speech;VivaEval;Canada;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/vivaeval

column1: Wagabit;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-0QfknHwoJA;"Wagabit is a platform that connects buyers with relevant sellers or service providers in their local area. It allows users to submit requests for products or services they are looking for

column1: The Gemini API is utilized within Wagabit to efficiently match buyer requests with potential sellers. Seller profiles
column2: including detailed descriptions of their products and services
column3: are saved in Pinecone
column4: a vector database. When a buyer submits a request
column5: the system first filters the seller data using Pineconeƒ??s vector search
column6: comparing the buyerƒ??s request against the stored seller vectors to find the most relevant matches. This initial filtering narrows down the potential matches based on similarity to the buyer's request. The filtered results are then submitted to the Gemini API for a final
column7: refined match that considers additional criteria such as location and specific preferences. This two-step filtering process ensures highly accurate and relevant connections between buyers and sellers
column8: facilitating prompt and successful transactions.";In addition to the Gemini API

column10: allowing users to set their preferred location and radius for finding relevant sellers or service providers. The Google Maps API was also instrumental in enabling the visualization of these locations on a map within the application. Additionally
column11: I integrated the Google Translate API to translate user requests and seller descriptions into English
column12: ensuring that the application could process and match requests accurately regardless of the original language used. This combination of APIs enabled a seamless
column14: and location-based service experience for users.;Daniel Getahun (BlackDiamond);Ethiopia;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/wagabit

column1: Weather 2 Go;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a_duMgT_58U;"The app uses weatherKit api to gather hourly forecast information for a specific longitude/latitude. We feed this into GEMINI (currently using gemini-1.0) as 1.5 is too expensive for a free app
column2: but does provide better answers. Using our custom prompt. The result is what you see on the site under ""Ideal"". We also do this for ""Summary""
column3: using GEMINI but in this case summary uses a daily forecast and custom prompts that use averages from gemini in the prompt.

column1: Last is ""Guide"" these are a series of custom prompts we ask GEMINI that are related to a location as a travel guide might provide.

We are using Google Maps API to geocode our longitude and latitude to street addresses or the Google unique location code. Also a hidden feature if you click on the dashed line below the map a street view prompt will be displayed.
Not sure it will ever happen
column2: but I also have a ""News"" prompt that is not working with Gemini. The only AI API that can do real time right now is Perplexity. It would be great to get more realtime news
column3: but I'm sure that is in the works. Right now Gemini does great with summarize the JSON data. However
column4: I am unable to include hourly data for the entire week as that is too much information for context. Right now I have to rely on the daily fx summaries to give to GEMINI instead of from hour values.";None

column1: WebA11y plans to give some of that control back to the users of the internet. The first step is in fixing the most common violation: ""non-existent or unsuitable alternative text for images."" With a simple click of a button

column3: Gemini does the heavy lifting. Each individual image URL and accompanying alt text from the web page's HTML are sent to Gemini to both assess and either keep (if suitable) or replace (if unsuitable or blank). Gemini does this in very quick time
column4: and sends the output back. WebA11y then rewrites the alt attribute with the results returned from Gemini.";Web/Chrome;Chiemezuo;Nigeria;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/weba11y-pronounced-web-ally

column1: Wunderous;re-Imagining generative AI as social platform for humans;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sB6m-kjajok;"Wunderous explores an idea related to multi-agent AI conversations
column2: but in different direction: connecting multiple humans through a single Gemini instance that acts as a mediator among them e.g. consider this chat:

column1: - Houman: Can you tell Sara that I said Hi?
- Gemini: Sure
column2: I will let Sara know.

column1: (later)
- Sara: Any news since we last interacted?
- Gemini: Yes
column2: Houman said Hi!

column1: Wunderous relies on system instructions to help Gemini generate cohesive dialogues
column2: e.g. to avoid an invalid dialogue such as

column1: - Houman: Can you tell Sara that I said Hi?
- Gemini: Sure Houman! Hey Sara
column2: Houman is saying Hi!

column1: (This is invalid because
column2: from Houman's perspective
column3: it's not addressing him
column4: and also because Sara might not be interacting with Wunderous until much later.)

column1: Just as a proof of concept
column2: instructions for interactive stories and textcasting with an audience are included
column3: but the core objective is to provide a toolset for experimenting with various instructions and setups for multi-user generative conversations e.g. a moderated debate room
column4: a journalism channel
column5: etc. The toolset
column6: in particular

column1: Zephyr;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pFjwcvyvKPw;"I created a runtime python API for Unreal Engine which allows for the creation of shapes
column2: spawn points
column3: vehicles
column4: lights
column5: and modification of environment lights. Players can join online multiplayer sandbox environments and build games through prompting. Each prompt includes the Unreal Engine python API and the player's request
column6: such as ""create a vehicle"". The response from Gemini contains python code which is executed within the game to achieve the player's request. Multiple shapes can be created at once with a prompt like ""Create a pyramid"" (which Gemini usually builds with multiple stacked boxes). Existing shape groups can be modified by looking at the pyramid and describing some modification
column7: like ""Add an entryway with pillars"". The server host can swap between Sandbox mode (where players build the game) and Game mode (where the game is played and the building abilities like prompting and flying are disabled). In Game mode
column8: it looks for spawn points at opposing ends of the map and spawns 2 teams at the opposing spawn points. Note that the default spawn point which exists when the server is first created should be deleted
column9: and at least 2 other spawns (representing the 2 team spawns) should be created before switching to Game mode. In the future
column10: I'd like to add a feature to configure the game win condition with prompts
column12: and add more settings like allowing players to use prompting during the Game mode.";Gemini API;Zephyr;United States;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/zephyr

Zwisch;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ge0_t-wy-Q8;"Most high-schools and college campuses lack a culture for carpooling
column2: yet student transportation contributes to the 16% of carbon emissions that come from cars.

column1: Why? Carpooling is simply not convenient. Most ridesharers aren't comfortable sharing a ride with strangers. Existing solutions are too time-consuming to setup
column2: riddled with complicated forms and menus.

column1: Zwisch organizes carpools within school communities
column2: where trust and safety are key. Students can request a ride with a simple sentence.

column1: Simply type a sentence or two about your ride details. Gemini analyzes your text and matches you with a rider/driver if possible.
The Gemini 1.5 Pro API converts natural language inputs and creates JSON ride objects. Whenever a new request or offer is created
column2: Gemini processes all unfulfilled requests and offers at once
column3: then matches them based on compatibility of route similarity
column4: timing
column5: and your preferences. A ride is created on Firebase Firestore
column6: and notifications are sent to both users.

column1: Zwisch was started by two friends
column2: Alessio Toniolo and Vedic Patel who were tired of campus traffic congestion and a lack of easy-to-use apps. Alessio (18) is a senior at Marist School and Vedic (18) is a senior at South Forsyth High School. Their home of Atlanta is notorious for traffic plus a lack of accessible public transportation. The carpooling solution
column3: Zwisch
column4: was designed to scale for schools
column5: colleges
column6: and even workplaces to mitigate bad traffic and mitigate the climate crisis.";Web/Chrome

column1: ;;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9Xcyj5zQ39s;Stowboard is your ultimate personal assistant when it comes to storing photos or bookmarking websites or making random notes at the spur of a moment. As people we tend to capture photos or bookmark sites or note down an address quickly in a notes application for later retrieval
column2: but as time passes on we find it tough to retrieve it back. Stowboard solves this by automatically analysing the content you store and tags them so that you can perform searches like - get me the addresses that i saved or get me the photos of the cutlery i took or get me the wallet website i saved making it much for easier for the user to locate their content instead of endlessly sifting through multiple apps. When storing images the app makes use of Gemini's vision capability to identify objects within the image to create tags and summary. With links the app extracts the title
column3: keywords and description and feeds it to the text generation capability of Gemini to create tags and summary. With text the app uses Gemini to categorise the text into address
column4: mobile number
column5: notes or reminders and creates a tag and summary from this. The tags and summary generated by Gemini is then converted to vector using Gemini's embedding capabilities and is stored in Redis. When the user searches for something the app converts the text into vector embedding using Gemini's embedding capabilities and does a vector based search. The app also uses Firebase auth
column6: Firestore and Firebase cloud functions.;Firebase;;India;https://ai.google.dev/competition/projects/stowboard

column3: links
column4: and attachments. By comparing these elements against known phishing patterns and behaviors
